INGREDIENTS:

 • Chicken – 500g (cut into medium pieces)
 • Onion – 2 big)
 • Fennel seeds (perumjeerakam) – ½ tsp)
 • Tomato – 2 medium )
 • Ginger garlic paste – 3 tsp
 • Red chilli powder – 1 tsp
 • Turmeric powder – ½ tsp
 • Coriander powder – 4 tsp
 • Garam masala – 1 ½ tsp
 • Water – 1/2 cup
 • Coconut Milk – 1 cup
 • Curry leaves – few
 • Cashew nuts – 2 tsp
 • Oil
 • Salt

TO MARINATE
 • Red chilli powder – 1 tsp
 • Turmeric powder – ½ tsp
 • Ginger garlic paste – 1 tsp
 • Lemon juice – 1 tsp
 • Salt
 
 METHOD:


1. Mix all the ingredients to marinate. Add little water into it and make it to a paste
 2. Add chicken pieces into it and mix well. Keep it in the fridge for half an hour
 3. Heat oil in a pan and roast the chicken pieces till its light brown in color
 4. To the pan add fennel seeds, sliced onion and curry leaves.
 5. Cook with the pan covered and stir in between till onion turns brown in color (It takes apprx 15-20 min for this)
 6. Add sliced tomato and cook till it becomes soft
 7. Add ginger garlic paste and cook for 2-3 min.
 8. Add red chilli, turmeric, coriander powder, garam masala and cook for 2-3 min.
 9. Add water and mix well.
 10. When it starts boiling add fried chicken.
 11. Add coconut milk and cook in medium flame with pan covered till it starts boiling and becomes thick and oil starts appearing on the top
 12. Garnish with cashew nuts and serve hot with appam, pulao
